turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Christ.  How'd you get here?

turns.speaker: CO
turns.text: Took bus, most of way.  I knew you would come here.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: And how'd you sneak up like that?

turns.speaker: CO
turns.text: Carefully.  Don't want to get shot by you.  Bad karma.  Anyway, you need me.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: I do?

turns.speaker: CO
turns.text: You think you are... .

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Invulnerable.

turns.speaker: CO
turns.text: In-vul-nerabo.  But you get ass kicked without me.

turns.speaker: CO
turns.text: You try get across Laos?  Get to Thailand?

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Yeah.  Got some business there. What are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: CO
turns.text: Go United States.  See Nguyen. Maybe teach economics.  Buy Cadillac.  Watch "Dynasty."

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: How you going to get there?  You can't trust the spooks to pull you out.  They'll use you up and throw you away.

turns.speaker: CO
turns.text: I know.  I go with you.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: I couldn't get you in.

turns.speaker: CO
turns.text: Yes you can.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Look, Co...

turns.speaker: CO
turns.text: Why you don't feel love?  Not allowed?  Dead inside, maybe?  You make yourself dead already so they can't kill you?  In-vulnerabo?  Bullshit!

turns.speaker: CO
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Minigun.  Come on.  Let's move. He's coming in on our open side.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: John.  My name is John.

turns.speaker: CO
turns.text: It doesn't hurt.  Why doesn't it hurt?

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Alternate LZ Zulu Sierra at 0500. It says "May have heat.  Don't be late.  All our love."

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Let's get that tent down!

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Stay on your heading, Captain.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Sorry, Sir.  Can't do it.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: That's an order.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Sorry, Sir.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: You pathetic scum.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Well, if there weren't POWs before, there are now.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: I don't work with spooks.  Not after that op in Cambodia.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: I'm authorized to get you out of here.  I thought that's what you wanted.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: What's the job?

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: Classic special forces op... hit fast... in and out.  Two men.  Two days.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Why me?

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: We like you.  At least the computer at Langley likes you.  Pulled your file because of various factors.  Service record. Area familiarity.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: I'm not jumping blind.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: Memo E-7 on top will cover the details.  An abandoned Vietnamese Army base in the North-central highlands may have a compound used as an internment camp.  As you can see the intelligence is soft.  These LANDSAT photos show huts... barracks.  It could be anything.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: What's the plan?

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: This operation is in two phases. Recon and rescue.  You are phase one.  Your two-man team will probe the site, confirm the presence of American POWs, if any, make photographic and tactical observations, then proceed to the extraction point without engaging the enemy.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: We don't try to pull out any of our guys if we find them?

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: Negative.  Absolutely not.  The phase two assault team will get them out.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: We just take pictures?

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: Don't look so disappointed.  It should be hairy enough... even for you.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: I didn't know you were a stick man, Rambo.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: I was crossed-trained in gunships.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: All this is for us?

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: He's giving them a run for their money.  Says here they've got two Hueys from Danang.  I didn't know those dinks had Hueys.

turns.speaker: TECH
turns.text: Half their air force is our stuff. Captured.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: Typical...

turns.speaker: TECH
turns.text: Sir, there's something else... a TRANSAT relay.  Just came through.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TECH
turns.text: Um... actually, no.  It looks like he shot down one of their gunships...

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: Christ almighty.

turns.speaker: TECH
turns.text: ... and then he, uh... took the other one.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TECH
turns.text: He... took it.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: How long have you been setting up?

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: About 22 hours on site.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Nice work.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: How long before you're fully on line?

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: Couple hours.  Let me buy you a coffee.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: You think they'll find any?

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: POWs?  I don't know.  But either way it'll get that subcommittee off our necks.  Cream?

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Black.  No sugar.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: The League of Families leans on Congress.  Then they lean on us. Like we don't have enough to worry about in a dozen dirtwater countries.  Damnit!

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Listen, Kirkhill.  I'm a bit of a fifth wheel in your setup here... I thought I'd go out with the extraction team tonight.  Unless you have an objection.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: It's not necessary.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: That's a pretty hairy ride.  Full Colonels are supposed to be above that sort of thing.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: I know...

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: Have fun.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Take your time.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: Look, Colonel... we're all adults here.  This is a war.  A very quiet, very intense war.  People get sacrificed.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Not my people.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: But you're right... some people do get sacrificed.  Now tell me why you pulled the plug.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: You think I'm some whacko?  I like to hurt people?  I'm doing a job here.  If I knew what's right or wrong I'd be a goddamned priest, right?  So I follow directives... I do what I'm told.  It's simple.  If your boy had done what he was told, there wouldn't be a problem.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Don't dance me, Kirkhill.  You'll be walking funny.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: Look, it was a screw-up, alright? They weren't supposed to find anything.  We thought that camp was empty.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: This mission was a scam from the word go?

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: Word came down... they wanted an answer.  And they knew the answer they wanted: no POWs.  But it had to look good.  Best effort.  The whole dog-and-pony show.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Rambo and Brewer were selected as write-offs.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: It was clean.  Very clean... Rambo was a decorated Vietnam vet, a former POW himself... if he came out and said "No POWs" the sub-committee would buy it.  He gets himself caught he's a private citizen, a whacko, acting on his own.  If he gets proof, it gets lost somewhere between here and D.C.  Airtight. But no... Rambo's gotta be a hero. Thinks he's starring in his own war movie or something.  He put me in a corner.  No choice.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: "Terminate with extreme prejudice."

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: That's a crock.  We don't say that. Do you have any idea the shitstorm if he'd gotten back with that guy? If it went public?  The White House would have to act through channels. We're talking ransom.  Four billion bucks in war reparations to Vietnam to get the others back.  That's billion, Colonel.  With a "B".  For a few guys that've had their brains in a blender for ten years?  A pain in the ass to everybody?  No way. There's no way.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: So there never was a Phase Two rescue team?

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: Of course not.  You can't get approval to rescue a kitten from a tree after Tehran.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: You're out of your depth, Trautman. Way out.  I'm acting correctly here. Not you.  Not your gung-ho jungle ace.  It's over.  Walk away.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: It's not over.  You made one mistake.

turns.speaker: KIRKHILL
turns.text: What that?

turns.speaker: PRISONER
turns.text: Who're you?

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: American.  Come to get you out.

turns.speaker: PRISONER
turns.text: Man, you are one scary-looking motherfucker!

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Can you walk?

turns.speaker: PRISONER
turns.text: I could a couple of days ago.  Gonna be... stiff.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: PRISONER
turns.text: De Fravio.  Dave De Fravio. Lieutenant... Air Force.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Hello, John.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Colonel.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Mind if I sit down?

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: I hear you're not enjoying it here.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: I could take it or leave it.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Seems like I'm always pulling you out of some goddamn toilet or other, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Am I out of here?

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: That depends on you.  Christ, look at you.  I give you this easy duty until I can get you an assignment... all you have to do is eat ice cream and watch soap operas... and you have to make it Rambo's last stand.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: There were treating me like a headcase.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Hard to believe.  You shoot up one little town in Oregon with a fifty caliber machine gun... one little dogpatch town... and everybody figures your wrapper's broken.  No sense of humor.  What did you expect?  An engraved plague from the chamber of commerce?

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: This your stuff?

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: That's it.  My life.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Hardcore outfit.  The best I ever trained.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Those men are all dead.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: You're not.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Congressional Medal of Honor.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Yeah.  Big time.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Plus, what else?  Two Silver Stars, four Bronze Stars, two Soldier's Medals, four Vietnamese Crosses of Gallantry and... uh, a handful of Purple Hearts.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Five.  I never wanted that stuff.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: What did you want?

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: I just wanted... I don't know... after all that... I just wanted one person, one person, to come up to me and say "you did good, John." And mean it.  That's all.  After all that.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: You just picked that wrong war to be a hero in.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: We left some people behind there, John... POWs.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: This just occurred to somebody, now?

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Listen up.  You two are married as of now.  Get used to it.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: I say we tape him to a chair.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: Let's do it.

turns.speaker: TRAUTMAN
turns.text: Keep it clean, Rambo, or I'll nail your hide to the shed.

turns.speaker: RAMBO
turns.text: You got it, sir.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: This will last you one year after which you have the option to renew if... you like at a membership discount.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: But now it's free, right?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: You know, I think I... ordered some just the other day.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Well did you or didn't you?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Yes!  They'll be in soon.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Well, I guess I'll come back then.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I like your nails.  Where did you get them done?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Ah... I do them myself.  I used to work in a beauty parlor.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I've never been in an apartment above a store.  You always pass them on the street but you never think anyone really lives in them.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Can I get you anything...coffee... tea...a little tequilla?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: No, thank you.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Will it hurt?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: That all depends on you. ...Sure you don't want a drink?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: ...So he says to me, "you'll never find another man like me"...I said, "please, men like you have one hand on their dicks and the other hand on their mother's leg... I said, there's the door - take a trip.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: You threw him out?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: My parents were divorced.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: It's an awful thing, let me tell you. My Aunt used to say,  "divorce is the sister-in-law of death".

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: ...SO...anybody special in your life?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Do I look like I have someone special?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Well, don't say it like that. It's not so...ya know, crazy an idea. You are a healthy woman... You hold a steady job. Ya not crossed eyed or anything...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Well, there's nobody special!

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I mean, it's not easy in this day and age.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Meeting ... people.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Tell me about it. I've been dating longer than I've been driving. I can't believe that.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I never really...went through a... dating period.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: It's a disgusting process. You haven't missed anything.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: ...My mother calls every week. Like a recurring nightmare. "So, have you met anyone?"..."No mom".. "So what's going to happen?"... "I don't know Mom"... I only thank God I moved out.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: I can't believe you lived with her for that long. If I had to live with my mother, I'd stab myself six times.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I think some people are meant to be alone.  Maybe I was a man in a former life and I used women for pleasure so now I'm paying for it - which would be fine, if I could just remember some of the pleasure parts...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: I don't understand you. What is the problem?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I don't feel like I make any impression on people... At office parties I spend my time re-arranging the hors d'oeuvres as people eat them, so the platters will always look full. I don't start conversations because I have no idea how to end them...I think I'm just meant to live in the background of things.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: That's not true...You gotta ease up... Conversations have a life of their own. You gotta just go with it...We're having a lovely conversation.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I'm paying you.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: You know, let me tell you something! I'm not that kind of person. I don't do people favors. If I talk to you it's because I want to. So we're not all ...uh...Jerri Hall...Big deal... What a boring world if we were. You do the best you can with what you got. You're not so so invisible, ya know... You want make an impression? Try this; you can be a real bitch.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Oh, no..I have to get home...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: The nails!! Watch the nails!!...  Listen, you still have to eat.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: No really..I can't.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Hey? What did I tell you? Why don't you come? It's just dinner. You'll have something to tell your mother next time she calls.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Getting your nails done is one thing but going to dinner with a bunch of strangers and <u>him</u>... She didn't even look at him.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Got any more bread crust?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: I mean, I've gone out with bums, but they were gorgeous.  It's the only reason to go out with a bum.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: This food's delicious.  You're a wonderful cook.  And you have a lovely home.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Jack, he's starting a conversation...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: <u>You're surprised</u>!... But I guess I just never met the right guy.  Whatta gonna do?

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: I'm shocked.  With a child bearing body like yours...  ... why a man would have to be out of his mind!

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Most men are.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Why this is outrageous!...

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Holdin' my penis... What a lovely way of sayin' how Much ya like me...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: <u>What are you, out of your mind</u>!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Yep! Right on it!

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Huh...the restaurant's just around the corner here...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Are you in a mood today baby? Is this one of those days when you're in ...whadda call it... an emotional abyss?  Talk to me, cause I don't understand these moods.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Anne, they're MY moods. If you want to understand moods, have one of your own!

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Why don't you go upstairs... take the day off. All right?...I'll cook tonight.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Well, it's funny!  Whatta want from me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's not funny.  It's... sophomoric and mindless... and dumb.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Then why the hell do we watch all the time?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Because it makes me feel good to see how not funny it is and how America doesn't know the first thing about funny which makes it easier not being a famous funny TV celebrity because that would just mean that I'm not really talented.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: It happens to be a beautiful love story.  Ya know, you used to like that about me.  You used to say you liked that I didn't make you think so much.  That we could be together and not think...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, well... suicidal paranoiacs say funny things sometimes.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: I smell gas... Do you smell gas...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: I can't tell you how distraught I was.  All night long.  What the hell happened?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I was attacked.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: <u>What</u>!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Two kids tried to set me on fire.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: <u>Oh my God</u>... <u>What did they do</u>!  <u>My</u> <u>God</u>!!!

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: You were attacked.  My God.  Should I call a doctor!  Did you call the police...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, I'm fine... really...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: You're all right... you sure...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: ... So... where did you sleep last night?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I... I stayed at a friend's.  Listen, I --

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Please... before you go on... let me tawk... okay... We've had a wonderful time together... When we first met, you said this wasn't serious and I shouldn't get serious and then you moved in and we haven't been serious. And I just wanna say that I have no regrets.  None.  And don't wanna have any now so I want ya to be up front with me... I want the truth. If you're seein' somebody else, let me know... You don't have to pour gasoline on yourself and light a match just to break up with me.  Just tell me the truth.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm not seeing anyone else.  I really was attacked.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Okay.  ... I love you...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Oh, I used to be such a Catholic.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You still believe in God?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Oh sure... Gotta believe in God.  But I don't think God made man in his own image.  No.  'Cause most of... the bullshit that happens, is because of men.  No, I think man was made out of the devil's image and women were created out of God -- because women can have babies which is sorta like creating, and which also explains why women are attracted to men, because, lets face it, the devil is a helluva lot more interesting -- I slept with a few saints and let me tell you... <u>Booooorring</u>!!!... And so the whole point of life, I think, is for men and women to get married so the devil and God can live together and, ya know -- work it out...  ... Not that we have to get married.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: ... You have a little... uh... something on your face...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Oh, I got a pimple... This stuff is supposed to blend with my skin color... Like it really works, ya know...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I tell you something, Anne.  I really feel like I'm cursed.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Oh stop.  Things will change.  My Aunt Mary always said, there's a remedy for everything in this world except death and having no class.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I get this feeling like I'm... a magnet but I attract shit.  Out of all the people in this city, why did I meet a man who's wife I killed?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: You didn't kill anybody.  Stop.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I wish there was some way I could... just... pay the fine and go home.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Can I have my desk please.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hello, I'd like to speak to Lydia?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Lydia?!  Lydia who!?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know her last name... I'll be off in a second.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: You're calling <u>Lydia</u> in <u>my</u> office. You must think I'm some dope.  You fuckin' bastard... You...  ... stay out all night long...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What... No... Lydia... I want to speak to... her name is Lydia... I...uh...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: ... I don't get a friggin' phone call.  You stroll in here at noon.  I got... two people out sick.  Ya think I need this?  I Do Not Need This!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: ...<u>Forget it</u>... <u>Goodbye</u>!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I was not with a woman last night.  I was out with Parry.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: The moron?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He's not a moron.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: And who's Lydia?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Lydia is the girl Parry likes... And I thought, if I could get them together I...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: What?  The curse'll be lifted?  <u>Will</u> <u>you please</u>!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I... You're not going to understand this.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Don't treat me like I'm stupid.  It pisses me off.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: All right... Sorry... I feel indebted to him.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: See, I told you!

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Well, what the hell does that mean?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I thought... if... if I can help him in some way... you know?... get him this girl he loves... Then... maybe.... things'll start changing for me... My luck, ya know... Maybe...  Forget it... It's a stupid idea.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Hello....congratulations.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And this is our other..uh...co-worker.. Parry..uh...Parry....

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: I don't know... He's a little disgusting... Although some women go for that.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He just needs some clothes?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well talk back.  He won't bite you.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Thank you very much.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: What are you two up to?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well..everything's closed up. We thought we'd get some dinner.  Say!....Anybody up for Chinese?  Have you eaten? Would you like to come along?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: I think they're made for each other. And it scares me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You know, I can't believe I did it. You think it'll work out?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Who's knows. My Aunt Marge used to say, "some matches are made in heaven, some are made in hell and some are made in hardware stores".

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nothing it's just...I begining to understand you.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Well...I think you should feel very proud. You did a real nice thing for somebody else. I'm very proud.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You were great. Thanks alot.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: So what's going on?  Who's Lou again?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: My agent.  I called my agent.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: You're kidding!  What did he say?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He says if I want to get back to work, no problem.  He wants me to come in and talk and... and... <u>that's</u> <u>it</u>!

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: <u>Whoah</u>!  Oh, honey, that's terrific!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I've got to put these tapes in some kind of order... and... Oh, I should get my sports jacket cleaned...  ... There's coffee if you want...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: <u>You</u> made coffee?... You're going back to work <u>and</u> you made coffee?... I love this!

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: It's so great to see you like this, honey... I can't tell you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Ya know, I'm thinkin' -- with another income coming in, I would love to get a bigger place.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ugh, these tapes are a mess.  I don't know where to begin...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: ... I would love to start looking at least.  You know, maybe a two bedroom or even, maybe the top floor of a house -- like in Brooklyn or Staten Island...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: ... What?... You don't want to commute?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, it's not... Come here...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: "I'm an incredible woman?"  What is this, a death sentence?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, I... I think we should talk about this.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: You want to talk?  Come on, Jack... Did I cross the line by mentioning the future or what?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No... it's just...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: ... Listen, so much has happened and I think it would be a good thing for both of us if we slowed things down a little.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Slowed things down?  Where have I been?  Have we been going fast!?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Right now, I'm just not sure about... making such definite plans.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: ... I'd like to focus on my career - - now than I can, now that everything's all right... Parry's taken care of... and... Like I said, I feel like I know a lot more now and I don't...

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: First of all, let me tell you something -- you don't know shit. Second of all, as far as <u>we</u> go, what time do you need?  What have we been doing here, except <u>time</u>?  Have I ever... ever pressured you!?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: No.  So what time do you need?  I love you -- you love me -- you want to get your career going, great!  I'd like to be a part of it -- I think I deserve that!  So what do you need to figure out alone!?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: You can't even give me that?!  What were you gonna do, Jack?... Just gonna organize your life...  ... walk out that door, move in by yourself and what -- drop the news when you find somebody else?  What were you planning to do, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I didn't know.  I just said all I want is some time.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Bullshit!  If you're going to hurt me, you hurt me now -- not some long... drawn out hurt that takes weeks of my life because you don't have the balls!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: All right... I'll pack my stuff tonight.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: What have you been doing here!  <u>Huh</u>! <u>I wanna know</u>!  <u>What have you been</u> <u>doing here</u>?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: <u>Listen</u>!  We both got something out of it, all right!

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Oh yeah?  What did I get?  What did I get I couldn't've gotten from somebody with no name any night of the week?  You think your company is such a treat?  Your moods, your...  "pain", your problems... You think you're entertaining?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Then what do you want to stay with me for?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Well!  What do you want me to do - applaud?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How have you been?

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Terrific. Going on alot of dates ... seeing lots of men... lots of dates..

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I think.. I...I realized...I love you.

turns.speaker: ANNE
turns.text: Huh-huh....You son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Parry?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: He can't hear you.  Hi...I'm Dr. Weintraub....  I was on duty when they brought him in...I've been going over his record... He was brought in once before I understand...  ..."catatonic  stupor"...condition  rendered him non-verbal for a period of -...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah so? The guy's beat up - he...he probably has a concussion or something, right?  He'll snap out of it?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I'm afraid not ... Then again, I'm not sure. The beating's bad but it's not the problem... It seems he's.. re-experiencing the catatonia... So, like before, he could snap out it in an hour or in thirteen months or thirteen years... ....I don't know. There's no way to tell.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But..How could that happen?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Well, it's not unusual in his case... Sometimes victims of tragedies are subject to the brain's replay system. The brain never loses anything - it just stores it up and waits. A person could actually re-experience the full effect of a tragedy, long after the event took place. Are you relatives?  Well, it doesn't matter. We'll take care of it. He'll have to be sent back to the same institution..

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What if I was a relative?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: You'd have the option to care for him at home but my advice is it wouldn't be the best thing for him. He needs hospital care. I just thought you could sign the release forms, but the city can do that. I wouldn't feel responsible in any way. There's really nothing you can do. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So, Edwin, baby, this is Sunrise Confession time... what have you got for us?

turns.speaker: EDWIN
turns.text: I... I... went to this bar... this very, ya know -- hard-to-get-in place... called Babbitt's...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, I know the place.  It's one of those chic <u>yuppie</u> gathering holes.

turns.speaker: EDWIN
turns.text: Okay... I know but... I met this beautiful girl...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, but does she swallow, Edwin?

turns.speaker: EDWIN
turns.text: I think she likes me... she gave me her number, but she must work a lot cause when I call she's never home... But I think we'll go out this weekend... I've...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah, Edwin, <u>sure</u>... and <u>Pinnochio</u> is a true story... <u>Edwin!  Wake up!</u> This is a fairytale...

turns.speaker: EDWIN
turns.text: No, Jack, no, it's not... She likes me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She gave you the old brusheroo, kiddo... Believe me -- this tart will never make it to your desert plate...

turns.speaker: EDWIN
turns.text: She <u>likes</u> me.  She said for me to call!

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Where you comin' from?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh... basement I think...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: <u>I tell him no visitors</u>!!!

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You a friend of Parry's?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No...  He is supposed to live there?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Yeah, well... I let him stay there. What else could I do after such a tragedy?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tragedy?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: He and his wife was were at some bar ..and some nut came in with a shotgun and blew the place apart. She was a beautiful girl...She never knew what hit her.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Can I help you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm... just looking for Parry...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: He's not here.

turns.speaker: GAY BUM
turns.text: I wanna go...Just let me go...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Uh...Where...where do you want to go?

turns.speaker: GAY BUM
turns.text: A real nice place I know... Ah...can't get there! Not tonight.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where?  Maybe we can.

turns.speaker: GAY BUM
turns.text: No...no...we can't...we can't..

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Come on...maybe we can...where do you want to go?

turns.speaker: GAY BUM
turns.text: Venice...Like Katherine Hepburn in SUMMERTIME. . ....Why can't I be Katherine Hepburn...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Can you tell me something? Did you lose your mind all of a sudden or was it a slow gradual process?

turns.speaker: GAY BUM
turns.text: Well,... I'm a singer by trade... Summer stock...nightclub revues... that kind of thing...It used to be what I absolutely lived for...God...I can do GYPSY backwards - every part- but, one night...in the middle of singing "Funny..... - it suddenly hit me... ...what does all of this really mean?  That, and the fact that all my friends are dead...God, I sound like a veteran. Dad would be so proud.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Um...I've got to run. I've bee doing this all day.  Are you going to be all right?

turns.speaker: GAY BUM
turns.text: Oh please!...I was born a Catholic in Brooklyn... I've been to hell and back.... I'll be fine...  ....Thanks...You're a gem.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Remember. One chorus and out.

turns.speaker: GAY BUM
turns.text: I'm a man with a mission, Jack.

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: It's O.K...It's O.K...Lets me help you up.

turns.speaker: GAY BUM
turns.text: NO...I WANNA GO! I WANNA GO NOW!

turns.speaker: PARRY
turns.text: Come on now...You can't sit here.

turns.speaker: GAY BUM
turns.text: NO! I want a debutante on a horse to step on me.  Leave me alone!!
